io.basic.ddf.content

Class PersistenceHandler.BasicPersistible

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.ddf.types.AGloballyAddressable
      • io.ddf.content.APersistenceHandler.APersistible
        • io.basic.ddf.content.PersistenceHandler.BasicPersistible
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IHandlePersistence.IPersistible, ISerializable, IGloballyAddressable, Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    PersistenceHandler

    public static class PersistenceHandler.BasicPersistible
extends APersistenceHandler.APersistible
    Base class for objects that can persist themselves (e.g, Models) via the BasicObjectDDF persistence mechanism
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected DDF newContainerDDFImpl()
      Each subclass is expected to instantiate a new DDF, put this APersistenceHandler.APersistible object inside of it, and return that DDF for persistence.
      static ISerializable unwrapDeserializedObject(List<?> dataRows, ISerializable deserializedObject, com.google.gson.JsonElement deserializedWrappedObject)
      Special case: if we hold a single object of type IPersistible, then some magic happens: we will return *that* object as a result of the deserialization, instead of this DDF itself.

      • newContainerDDFImpl

        protected DDF newContainerDDFImpl()
                           throws DDFException
        Description copied from class: APersistenceHandler.APersistible
        Each subclass is expected to instantiate a new DDF, put this APersistenceHandler.APersistible object inside of it, and return that DDF for persistence.
        Specified by:
        newContainerDDFImpl in class APersistenceHandler.APersistible
        Returns:
        Throws:
        DDFException

      • unwrapDeserializedObject

        public static ISerializable unwrapDeserializedObject(List<?> dataRows,
                                     ISerializable deserializedObject,
                                     com.google.gson.JsonElement deserializedWrappedObject)
                                              throws DDFException
        Special case: if we hold a single object of type IPersistible, then some magic happens: we will return *that* object as a result of the deserialization, instead of this DDF itself. This makes it possible for clients to do things like
        PersistenceUri uri = model.persist(); Model model = (Model) ddfManager.load(uri); instead of having to do this:
        PersistenceUri uri = model.persist(); BasicDDF ddf = (BasicDDF) ddfManager.load(uri); Model model = (Model) ddf.getList().get(0);
        Throws:
        DDFException
